Azure IoT Hub

Connect, monitor and control millions of IoT assets, and improve the security of IoT solutions

Apply for 1RMB Trial Buy Now

Connect, monitor, and manage millions of IoT assets running on various operating systems and agreements to rapidly start your Internet of Things projects through Azure IoT Hub. If required, control access to specific devices to maintain system integrity. The reliable two-way communication (even intermittent connections) can be established with the help of these assets so as to analyze the input remote-sensing data and send commands and notifications according to requirements. Improve the security of IoT solutions by using the identity verification of each device and through suitable credentials and equipment communications.

Pricing Details

The Azure IoT Hub has three editions: the Free Edition, S1 Edition, and S2 Edition, which are now published by the Azure IoT Hub. The new pricing will take effect as indicated below.

Free Edition: free trial of Azure IoT Hub services. Upon signup, you can transmit up to 8,000 messages per day. It is suitable for understanding and testing features of IoT Hub Services.

S1 Edition: the IoT Hub S1 edition is designed for IoT solutions that generate relatively small amounts of data. Each pricing unit of the S1 Edition allows you to transfer up to 400,000 million messages per day across all connected devices.

S2 Edition: the IoT Hub S2 Edition is designed for IoT solutions that generate relatively large amounts of data. Each pricing unit of the S2 Edition allows you to transfer up to 6 million messages per day across all connected devices.

*The following prices are tax-inclusive.

*Monthly pricing estimates are based on 744 hours of usage per month.

FAQ

Expand all
  • What is included in the free edition of Azure IoT Hub?

    The free version of the Azure IoT Hub is designed to promote concept proofing projects. It allows you to transmit up to 8,000 messages a day and sign up for up to 500 device IDs. Device ID restrictions now only exist in the free version.

  • What is included in the S1 Edition of Azure IoT Hub?

    Each pricing unit of the S1 Edition allows you to transfer up to 400,000 messages per day across all devices. If more than 400,000 messages are transmitted on all devices each day, you will need to purchase more units.

  • What is included in the S2 Edition of the Azure IoT Hub?

    The S2 Edition of Azure IoT Hub is used for scenarios where the customer has a large number of devices and generates large amounts of data, thus requiring frequent transmission of messages. Each pricing unit of the S2 Edition allows you to transfer up to 6 million messages a day. If more than 6 million messages are transmitted on all devices each day, you will need to purchase more units.

  • How to increase or decrease the number of IoT Hub units purchased?

    The pricing of Virtual Machine instances doesn’t include any storage fee associated with the mirror image run in the Virtual Machine.

  • What is the maximum message size I can send through the IoT Hub?

    The maximum size of messages that can be sent from the device to the cloud is 256 KB. In the paid versions (S1 and S2), these messages are measured by 4 KB. For example, if the device sends a 16 KB message via S1 or S2 edition, the message will be billed as 4 messages. Messages sent by connected devices via the free version are measured by 0.5 KB. For example, if a device sends a 16 KB message via the free Edition of the IoT Hub, the message will be billed as 32 messages.

    As for the paid SKU (namely S1 Edition and S2 Edition), the maximum size of messages that can be sent from the cloud to the device is 64 KB. Such messages are measured by 4 KB. For example, an 8 KB message sent via the S1 or S2 Edition will be billed as 2 messages. Messages sent via the free version are measured by 0.5 KB. For example, a 8 KB message sent via the free edition of the IoT Hub will be billed as 16 messages.

  • What are the billing methods for Azure IoT Hub services?

    The usage of purchased IoT Hub units is calculated on a daily basis, generating monthly bills. Customers are billed based on the number of IoT Hub Units consumed during the month.

  • If I purchase extra IoT Hub units in the middle of the month, will I be charged pro rata?

    You can choose to increase the number of IoT Hub Units purchased at any time. If the service is signed up for in the middle of the month, the cost for this month will be calculated in proportion to the remaining days of the month. (For IoT Hub Services, one month is defined as 31 days). If you increase the number of IoT Hub Units in the middle of the month, the cost for this month will be calculated based on the number of units available each day this month.

  • If business needs change, can the number of units be reduced?

    Yes, you can reduce the number of units at any time from the “Settings” page. Changes will take effect the next day and will be reflected on the bill at the end of the month.

  • Can I switch from the free edition to the paid edition?

    No, you can not switch from the free edition to the paid edition. The free edition is only for testing concepts and proofing solutions.

  • Can I switch between the S1 Edition and S2 Edition of IoT Hub?

    Yes, you must take steps to explicitly switch from one paid edition to another. Device identities and messages released are passed to the new edition. Switching from the paid edition to the free edition is not allowed.

Support & SLA

If you have any questions or need help, please visit Azure Support and select self-help service or any other method to contact us for support.

For IoT Hub, we guarantee that, at least 99.9% of the time, the deployed IoT Hub can send information to and receive information from registered devices, and the service can perform operations such as creation, reading, updates, and deletion on the IoT Hub.

Service Level Agreement is not available in the free edition of IoT Hub.

To learn more about the details of our Service Level Agreement, please visit the Service Level Agreements page.
